intro: Dissotis glandulicalyx, commonly known as the glandular-leaved dissotis, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. Its leaves are often covered in tiny glands, giving it a distinctive appearance and aiding in its identification. Dissotis glandulicalyx is often found in wet or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
